Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand have four big fixtures in a row in the shape of India, Australia, South Africa and Pakistan, which will give a true litmus test of just how good the Kiwis are.
India continue to look unstoppable. Another routine victory came against Bangladesh, and their batting unit appears ever more indestructible.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India v New Zealand will take place on Sunday 22nd October 2023.
India v New Zealand will start at 9:30am.
You can watch the match live on Sky Sports Cricket and Main Event from 9am.
Others: The top three of Rohit Sharma, Shubman Gill and Virat Kohli is the envy of the world, and it’ll require a remarkable performance from New Zealand to stop them in their tracks.
Tom Latham (New Zealand) will be vital in combating India’s left-arm spinner Ravindra Jadeja.
